fields.summary: TAKADO

fields.description:
Саша, во вложении превью макетов ТМ ХД «Батон», необходимо внести правки и сделать два варианта:
Вариант №1
•	Заменить надпись на этикетке и колпаке «пол батона» на «півбатона»
•	Заменить надпись на этикетке «білый» на «білий»
Вариант №2
•	Заменить надпись на этикетке и колпаке «пол. батона» на «0,5л. батона»
•	Заменить надпись на этикетке «білый» на «білий»
fields.summary: first

fields.description: Since a few days a number of issues show up incorrectly in My Open Issues: they were closed on the Agile board, but show up as open in that filter.
fields.summary: My Open Issues reports some JIRA Agile issues as being open, while they are closed already

fields.description: Is it possible to create a burndown chart by User Story? Currently only a burndown by epic or version is available.
fields.summary: Agile dashboard: burndown chart per user story

fields.description:
I am a customer of JIRA OnDemand.  The screen Admin->System->System info says that this is OnDemand version 6.4-OD-04-006 (build 64001), which I assume is the latest version as of today's date (Sept. 5, 2014, 8:45am Pacific).

I tried to bulk edit issues in my project, but ran into problems:

- Ran a simple search query to get a list of issues  
- Chose Tools -> Bulk Change (6 issues)
- Selected checkboxes for the 2 issues I wanted to change, clicked Next
- Chose Edit issues, clicked Next
- Scrolled down the field edit form to find the "Change Sprint" field
- The text box to the right of the Change sprint label contains an exception message (see first copy and paste below of exception text for details).  It seems kind of weird that the text box itself, meant for inputting a sprint, contains text.
- If I delete the exception text and type in the name of my sprint (simply "sprint 1"), the typeahead doesn't work. 
- If I check the field sprint checkbox and enter the name of the sprint text anyway and click Next, I get a similar exception on the returned page (see second copy and paste below of exception text for details).

I am able to easily reproduce this problem in 2 of my projects.  Note sure if this info matters, but:

- The issues I'm trying to change have multiple sprints listed in their sprint field (they were rolled over from 1 sprint to another, so both were recorded).  
- The issues I'm trying to change are of type "Story"

If you have questions, please feel free to reach out to me.

-Curt

fields.summary: Exception during bulk issue change - sprint field

fields.description:
Often it's difficult to get a precise update for a given time on a burndown chart. 

My most common use case is that I want to see where I'm at now (for story points) in relation to how far ahead/behind schedule I am. 
My other use case is that I want to see at a given time in the future how many story points I should be at for the guideline. 

My current workaround is to use my Page Ruler Chrome extension to be able to reference that. It'd be nice if the chart just use crosshairs instead.
!burndown-crosshairs.JPG|thumbnail!
Going above and beyond would be the option to enable a tooltip as well (shows the x,y axis values for wherever you'd be hovering).
fields.summary: Add crosshairs to burndown chart

fields.description:
Seems limited to editing a story that has an attachment from a board.  The message appears when a board loads, then trying to open an issue with an attachment. I’m able to open and edit other stories.  

When I edit the item from my open issues list, it works fine. Using that method, I removed the attachment and am able to update the item from a board. When I attached the item again, the error returns.
fields.summary: Unable to open issues with attachments from any board

fields.description:
Currently the only way to track progress within Agile/SCRUM via the burndown chart is to base it on either story points or hours.  The best solution for this is to create sub-tasks and assign hours in order to get a better representation of process within a sprint.  The biggest problem with this is maintaining a lot of "extraneous" issues, when really only one (for the user story) is needed.

It would be nice if instead of sub-tasks, an issue could have a checklist-type field that could used as an estimation statistic for sprint progress tracking (perhaps assign hours to each checklist task).  This would allow for only one issue per user story.

Thank you for your consideration.
fields.summary: Add checklist field that can be used for burndown reporting

This is rather unsightly, especially when viewing the dashboard as a wallboard.

Receiving Internal Server Error on Scrum Board

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11487].
  {panel}

The configuration pages can't be accessed. The big error modal window pops up and you get an "Internal Server Error" 

Here is what I see when I use firebug:
{code}
Got an error response with text that we don't know how to parse: {"status-code":500,"stack-trace":"java.lang.NullPointerException\n\tat com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.ColumnEditRequest$StatusDetails.from(ColumnEditRequest.java:145)\n\tat com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.ColumnEditHelper.asStatusEntry(ColumnEditHelper.java:330)\n\tat com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.ColumnEditHelper.buildColumnStatusesModel(ColumnEditHelper.java:313)\n\tat com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.ColumnEditHelper.buildColumnEditModel(ColumnEditHelper.java:185)\n\tat com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewEditHelper.getEditModel(RapidViewEditHelper.java:139)\n\tat com.atlassian.greenhopper.web.rapid.view.RapidViewEditResource$7.call(RapidViewEditResource.java:191)\n\tat 
{code}

h4. Cause:

A status label was renamed. In my example, from *To Do* to *TO DO*. When you try to access the board, it sees that *To Do* does not exist, so it attempts to create it again, since it requires it. But unfortunately, since *TO DO* is essentially the same, it fails. This is a problem with case sensitivity. *Note:* I think this only happens if you edit a status that is already there by default to use a different case.

h4. To Replicate

# Go to {{secure/admin/ViewStatuses.jspa}} View Statuses, edit a default status to be in all caps for the name (e.g. To Do > TO DO)
# *Create Project > Agile Software Development - Scrum*. Proceed through steps to create.
# Attempt to create an issue in new project, *Error: Could not find workflow status for issue [ ]*
# View *Issues Panel* in Overview: {noformat}An error occurred whilst rendering this message. Please contact the administrators, and inform them of this bug. Details: ------- org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getUrl' in class com.atlassian.jira.projects.legacy.projectpanel.fragment.impl.StatusSummaryFragment$StatusUrlUtil threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at legacy/templates/projectpanels/fragments/issues/statussummary.vm[line 18, column 50] at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.handleInvocationException(ASTMethod.java:337) at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTMethod.execute(ASTMethod.java:284) at ...{noformat}
# Go to *Agile Simplified Workflow Scheme for Project* and try to click *View as text* next to *Agile Simplified Workflow for Project*, and you will get another error, *The JIRA server was contacted but has returned an error response. We are unsure of the result of this operation.* You will still be able to go directly to the workflow from the main Administration screen and view as text.

h4. The Workaround

This issue can be fixed with a manual database change. If you're running into it in a Cloud instance, please contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/]. Alternatively for server please refer to our [Internal Server Error when accessing Rapid board|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILEKB/Internal+Server+Error+when+accessing+Rapid+board] KB article.
fields.summary: Internal Server Error on Agile Boards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11483].
  {panel}

When a completed issue that is in a current sprint is added to a version, it is displayed on the Release Burndown report.

If a completed issue that is in an already completed sprint is added to a version, it is NOT displayed on the Release Burndown Report.

By taking a look at the documentation (https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AGILE/Viewing+the+Release+Burndown), we can see that:
{quote}
Issue completed in a sprint, but only added to the version afterwards:
- The issue will be shown on the report, as if it was always part of the version.

{quote}

It is not clear if completed issues that are added to the version afterwards should always appear on the Release Burndown report, independent of belonging to an already closed sprint or not. Could you please take a look at that and, in case it is the expected behaviour, update the documentation to make it more clear to customers?

h5.To get the issues show on Release Burndown Report:
# *If issues resolved without Fix Version:*
#- Reopen the issues, add a Fix Version and transit the tickets back to Resolved (such as Resolved, Completed, Closed or Done).
# *If issues resolved contains Fix Version:* 
#- Reopen the issues and transit the tickets back to Resolved (such as Resolved, Completed, Closed or Done).

Thanks!
fields.summary: Completed issues added to a version have different behaviour on Release Burndown report

fields.description:
Current release (6.6.21-D20141105T072822), when creating a new _Agile Software Development - SCRUM_ project through project template, it will automatically be assigned to _Simplified Workflow_ instead of Default JIRA workflow. The new changes will create a _new workflow scheme_, _Screen Scheme_ and _Issue Type Screen Scheme_ for that project. 

The previous version (6.6.0-D20140904T040435) associates the default workflow with the default schemes.

Some customers are not aware with the new changes of Jira Agile's project template, and will require to change their internal processes to accustom to that changes. Furthermore, the lack of information on this change results some inconvenience for the customer to rectify the created projects after the release. And especially for OnDemand customers, this should be communicated better for them as there is no possibility of rolling back.

*Suggestion*

It would be great if the old project template is retained so the users can choose which project template they want to use. Or alternatively, a step by step approach to inform them of this change.

*Additional Information*

* Previous Version:
- 6.6.0-D20140904T040435

The scheme that is previously used:

!Project Template - Before.jpg|thumbnail!

* Current Version:
- 6.6.21-D20141105T072822

The scheme for current version:

!Project Template - After.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Retain the old project template whenever there is a new changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11459].
  {panel}

If a Story that has sub-tasks is assigned to another Sprint, JIRA Agile changes Sprint field for the sub-tasks too. However, no event is sent for the sub-tasks in the JIRA event system - neither ISSUE_UPDATED, nor GENERIC_EVENT.

This presents a problem for other plugins like Structure, which listen for the events and react to them. In particular, Structure's synchronizers are not able to maintain correct representation of the Sprints if its filter synchronizer does not check the updated issue.

Reproduction sequence:
1. Create a story in the backlog
2. Create a sub-task for that story
3. Assign story to Sprint 1, observe: sub-task is also assigned to Sprint 1

Expected: internal event is sent for the story and for the sub-task (issueUpdated or issueGenericEvent)
Observed: the event is sent only for the story

The observation can be done by registering an IssueEventListener. You can also use Structure to verify that the event is not sent:

A. Install Structure
B. Open Structure | Manage Structure, click "Settings" for the structure in the "Sync With..." column
C. Install "Filter" synchronizer with a JQL condition {{sprint = "Sprint 1"}}
D. Resync the synchronizer and open the structure to see all issues from Sprint 1
E. Continue with the reproduction sequence 1-3 above.

Observe: only the Story is added to the structure, but not the sub-task
fields.summary: When JIRA Agile updates sub-task's Sprint field, no event is sent inside JIRA

fields.description:
The 'Create Issue' option in Agile Plan Mode is gone after the release on November 3rd 2014. 

After the release, a few bugs were found in OnDemand. Some users are facing a bug similar to [this one|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-40653], but this one seems to be unrelated.

h4. Workaround

Workaround 1: It's still possible to create issues from JIRA normally.

Workaround 2: Disable the "jira-inline-issue-create-plugin" plugin:

# As a JIRA administrator, visit the add-on manager (Administration area >> Add-ons tab >> Manage add-ons).
# Search for "jira-inline-issue-create-plugin".
# Expand the plugin section.
# Click "Disable".

Side-effect: This will disable the 'Create Issue' widget under each sprint section in Plan Mode. Users can still create issues using other means.
Note that this add-on will be automatically enabled again by Atlassian when the fix is ready. If you have any trouble with the workaround please contact Support.
fields.summary: Create Issue option is missing in Agile Plan Mode after OD Release

  {panel}

h4. Summary:
On the *Work mode* (Scrum board), If the first (top) swim lane is unfolded/expanded, the display is correct.
However, if user folds in the top swim lane, none of the Issue keys in any of the swim lanes below are displayed: they are shown as a hyperlink with 3 dots "..."

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# Go to *JIRA Agile work mode* that has more than 1 swimlane
# Fold in the first swimlane
# Unfold/expand the other swimlanes
# The issue key will not be displayed. It will show *...* (triple dots) instead

h4. Additional Information
- Occurs in JIRA 6.3.6 with JIRA Agile 6.6.11, JIRA 6.3.9 with JIRA Agile 6.6.11
- This does not occur in JIRA 6.3.9 with JIRA Agile 6.6.0
- I changed the priority to *Major* due to the fact that it doesn't render *ISSUE KEY* properly.
fields.summary: Issue Keys are not rendered properly on Scrum work mode

fields.description: Currently, the Velocity Chart's *Completed* column only includes estimations from completed stories. By definition, the velocity is the measure of work done on a given interval/sprint. The measure would be more accurate if it includes stories that were also *worked on but not completed*. (stories that were part of the sprint but not moved to the Done column)
fields.summary: Velocity Chart should include amount of work done on incomplete stories in Completed column

fields.description:
At an attempt to open Issue Details for issues with attachments of file types that use zip structure (e.g. *.zip, .frt, .xlsx, .gliffy, pptx, .docx*), JIRA Agile throws errors:
{quote}java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: com/atlassian/jira/issue/attachment/AttachmentZipKit$FileCriteria{quote}
----
*Workaround 1*
Open the issues in a separate tab in the JIRA Issue View, and perform any operations there. Refresh the board to view changes.

*Workaround 2*
# As an admin or sysadmin, go to *JIRA Administration > System > Attachment Settings*.
# Click *Edit Settings*.
# Switch the _Enable ZIP Support_ option to "Off" and save the settings.
_Note:_ this will only disable the option to download all attachments as a single .zip file, and will not affect the availability of existing files (including .zip ones).

If you follow the second workaround, you'll want to re-enable the ZIP support setting once the fix is rolled out.

----

{panel}If you see Issue Keys on the board displayed as ellipsis ('...'), you're running into a different bug in Agile, GHS-11424.{panel}
fields.summary: Errors when opening Issue Details pane for issues with attachments

fields.description:

*Steps to reproduce:*
1 Try to access JIRA Agile Board using IE version 11, some users will get _Script Error_ message.
2. Notice the error appears

*Version*
6.6.11-D20141024T064516

fields.summary: Script errors when accessing Agile Board

fields.description: *Suggestion*: It would be awesome if it would Close issues that were mark as Resolved when we did a version release.
fields.summary: Releasing version closes issues in Resolved status

fields.description:
I'm not sure all the complexities to do this in your application however, I think a nice feature to have would be to fix the "quick filters" such that they persist between switching between work and plan mode. 

We have quick filters set and use them for plan and work mode views frequently however it really trips me up when i switch between the views and the filter changes. To me, filters should persist above views.
fields.summary: Switching Views - Keep Filter the Same

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When attempting to create a new board, the user may be unable to retrieve the shared filter depending upon where it is returned in the search results.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create the following saved filters:
{noformat}
Cash Management - A
Cash Management - B
Cash Management - C
Cash Management - D
Cash Management - E
Cash Management - F
Cash Management - G
Cash Management - H
Cash Management - I
Cash Management - J
Cash Management - K
Cash Management - L
Cash Management - M
Cash Management - N
Cash Management - O
Cash Management - P
Cash Management - Q
Cash Management - R
Cash Management - S
Cash Management - T
Cash Management - U
Cash Management - V
Cash Management - W
Cash Management - X
Cash Management - Y
Cash Management - Z
Man ABC
Man Man
Man_Man
{noformat}
# Create a new JIRA Agile board from an existing Saved Filter.
# Attempt to enter "Man Man" or "Man_Man".

h3. Expected Results

The filters are returned.

h3. Actual Results

The filters are not returned.

h3. Notes

It appears that there is a limitation in the number of results that the drop-down can return, and if the filter is returned after those results it does not appear. If all the 'Cash Management' filters do not exist, 'Man_Man' and 'Man Man' will appear.

h3. Workaround

Rename the filter something else temporarily, such as A Man ABC, and then use that as it will appear at the top of the list.
fields.summary: Unable to Find Shared Saved Filter when creating a New Board

fields.description: For Kanban boards, there is no Plan mode, so the automatic ranking of newly created features (GHS-6905) should apply to issues selected on the left-most column instead.
fields.summary: Ranking a new issue directly underneath the currently selected issue doesn't work on Kanban boards

fields.description:
Currently, the "Send to Top" and "Send to Bottom" ranking features are not visible on Kanban boards because the "right click" context menu does not show these commands in Work mode (and Kanban boards have no Plan mode).

There is a workaround by using shortcut keys; e.g., pressing "s" and "t" will rank the selected issues to the top of the current column, but that workaround is hard to discover.
fields.summary: "Send to top" should be available via the UI on Kanban boards

fields.description:
1) Can we please have a simple burndown chart that displays just 1 line, which is story points remaining for the release – the X-Axis should Iterations and the Y-Axis should be Points (we usually don’t need our charts at a daily level (iteration level is more than enough), although perhaps you would want to allow the user to select iteration or daily burndown options?)

2) Can we have a simple chart or dashboard to show  Cycle times per iteration,  ideally this would be broken down to T-Shirt size e.g. Extra Small, 1.3 days average, Small 2.4 days, Medium 3 days, Large 4.7 days, Extra Large 8.1 days

I've also updated the Burn-up chart idea https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-5513 as this seems an essential part of any serious Agile tool, and your product is currently missing this basic feature!
fields.summary: Improve Agile charts - Burndown and Cycle Times

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11397].
  {panel}

When using a Scrum Board, The Progress Bar is being shrunk 1/10 the size of the card in both Firefox 33.0.2 and Internet Explorer 9.

h3. Steps To Reproduce
- install JIRA Agile 6.6
- Create a sample scrum board
- Configure the board to add Progress, Original Estimate, and Due Date
- Move an issue to In Progress
- Log work for that issue

h3. Environment
- JIRA v1000.253.3

h3. Expected Results
Progress bar should extend across the entire card

h3. Actual Results
Progress Bar is a fraction the size of the card.
fields.summary: Scrum Board Incorrectly Displays Progress Bar

fields.description:
As a Certified Scrum Product Owner, I want a separate Acceptance Criteria field added to the list of Issue fields available for use so that I can write and format my acceptance criteria separately from the story description.

Several of the Agile training companies out there, such as Solutions IQ, advocate that User Stories contain an area for Acceptance Criteria.  The Product Owner is responsible for listing this criteria so the developers have a better understanding of how a feature might look and behave with user interaction.  Having the Acceptance Criteria also improves the grooming of the stories so the team's velocity is more accurate.

I had Acceptance Criteria as a separate field in Microsoft TFS and Version One.  I can enter all that information into the Description field but then everyone has to scroll to read every piece of detail about the story and acceptance criteria.  Also, many teams like to export some data fields from there Agile tool to create a large scale sprint wall to impress the executives.
fields.summary: Acceptance Criteria Field

fields.description:
Hi there,

We're starting to use an "impeded / blocked" flag for our JIRA tickets.  It would be nice to allow for that flag to trickle-up from subtask to parent ticket so when I look at the cards in the JIRA Agile Rapid View, I can see which parent tickets are indeed impeded / blocked.
fields.summary: Add option for trickle-up flag inheritance from sub-task to parent issue

fields.description: It would be nice to be able to specify whether a Sprint was global or restricted to a project or projects.
fields.summary: Ability to restrict Sprints to specific projects

fields.description: The list of Epics can be long. It would be ideal to be able to apply quick filters, and have these filter Epics also, not just stories.Also, the ability to order Epics alphabetically would be useful.
fields.summary: Filter Epics

fields.description:
One of the advantages of Kanban is to make your process visual and explicit. One part of it is to add your "Definition of done" at the bottom of every column. This is a short description of the conditions under which this step of the process can be considered complete. See an example here: http://technitai.wordpress.com/tag/game-design/

The idea would be to let board managers add a short check list of those steps that would be displayed at the bottom of each column.
fields.summary: Definition of Done on Kanban boards / Making Process Policies Explicit

fields.description:
Hello,
In Kanban, you can use the boards throughput to estimate future projects based on future data. The throughput is measured in issues/day.

For instance, if you know that your team has an average throughput of 0.5 issues/day and you have 10 issues to deal with, you can make a good estimation by saying that it would take 10 * 0.5 = 20 days. For a better estimation, you can also consider your bug/feature ration (the average number of bugs you introduce for every new feature). So if you have bug/feature ratio of 0.4 and you have 10 features to add, you should in fact count 14 issues.

So the feature would be the following:
* On the Kanban board report's, dislay the current values and the historic for the rolling average throughput, a bit like in the current control flow chart for Kanban boards. The throughput should be calculated based on the time it takes for an issue to cross the board, like cycle time.
* Also display somewhere the bug/feature ratio on the same page.

Before moving to Jira we were calculating the throughput based on our post-it notes and it proved to be a very valuable tool. I am missing this in Jira.

Let me know if you have any question.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Display Kanban boards throughput in report mode

Release burndown chart removes issues from sprint original estimate, which were removed from the version at a later time

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-11381].
  {panel}

When viewing the Release Burndown chart, if an issue has the fixVersion value updated, the report shows it as an unestimated issue. It follows below the steps to reproduce this behaviour:

1 - create a Scrum project and add a version (V1 for example)
2 - create some stories, set an Original Estimate and set fixVersion to V1
3 - create a sprint and add the stories created on step 2 to this sprint 
4 - go to the Release Burndown report. It will show the total estimate and “0% of unestimated issues” message, just like in release_burndown_original.png
5 - open one of the stories and remove V1 from the fixVersion field
6 - go back to Release Burndown report. It will show “X% of issues do not have an estimate (1 of Y)”, just like in release_burndown_updated.png

!release_burndown_original.png!
!release_burndown_updated.png!
fields.summary: Issues removed from Version counting as unestimated issues on Release Burndown chart

fields.description: We need to use reports available for Agile->Scrum Boards on the Dashboards in Jira and WIKI.
fields.summary: Add "Create Gadget" for all available Agile Scrum Board reports.

fields.description:
Currently the {{Release...}} button on the Kanban board cannot be used to also trigger a build on a Bamboo server. 

The workaround is to:
1) Create a release using the "Release..." link from the Kanban board (to set the fix version for all issues in the Done column)
2) From the "Manage Versions" screen in the project, "Unrelease" the release that was just created
3) From the "Manage Versions" screen "Build & Release" the same version in order to get Bamboo to build and link to the release

As we can see from above, using the Kanban board's Release button is great for adding fix versions to all those issues automatically, but the process feels disconnected because you cant get it to trigger a Bamboo build as well. 

The bottom line is for *the Kanban's {{release}} function to work the same way as JIRA project's {{Build and Release}} function.*
fields.summary: Trigger a Bamboo build directly from the Kanban board

h3. Work around

Restart JIRA Agile
fields.summary: JIRA Agile is throwing NPE on new board

fields.description:
As a Scrum Master I want to see bugs associated with a Story in that Story's swimlane in the Work Board so I can quickly determine if the Story is done.

One of the existing link types can be used for this or a unique link type can be created such as "required for done"
fields.summary: Put linked bugs in a Story's swimlane
ToolManagementProject

fields.description: It would be nice for the administrators to be able to see (in the list of boards in Manage Boards) the date that the board was created.
fields.summary: Created date on boards

fields.description: We have many teams that would appreciate if it would be possible to set more than one owner of a board.
fields.summary: Multiple owners on boards would help

fields.description: Why not have the ability to "Star" a favorite board in the Manage Boards view.
fields.summary: Ability to set a favorite star on Agile boards
